comments.commentBody:
To the writers Nelson and Shaila: Could you please follow up with more information regarding the AG's that are on board with this deal? Specifically, how many of them are Republican vs. Democrat, or from states with Republican vs. Democrat Governors. My bet is that it would be very telling. Both are equally responsible of course: it is President Obama's Attorney General's Office that is promoting and negotiating this deal.

I would urge all readers to take a few minutes to read this article that tells the more complete story of just what the banks' exposures are:

http://www.rollingstone.com/politics/blogs/taibblog/attorneys-general-se...

ex. Bank of America's exposure = $424 BILLION from just its Countrywide holdings alone!!

$424,000,000,000 for one bank's singular holdings vs $25 billion for 5 major banks' cumulative holdings together = Bank Bailout 2.0
Romney paid 14%, Debbie Bosanek (Mr. Buffett's secretary) paid 30-35 %.  Is that fair?
ALLY Bank used to be GMAC.
He's had over three years to put his money where his mouth is...  any other corporate stooge president could have read the teleprompter just the same.

What are you talking about?
You made $100, and paid $30 in taxes.
Then you invested the remaining $70 and Made $7.
According to current tax code you pay additional taxes only on the $7 gain (at 15% rate if it's capital gains).
Simple math.
Where is the double dip here?
Are you people ever going to let go of the "It's Bush's fault" excuse?

I agree. These businesses should not have been bailed out but rather they should have been allowed to fail for the poor choices in investments that they banked on.

When are we going to wake up and realize that a government that has the power to bail out our banking system also has the power to bankrupt it... which it is doing every time government spends more than it brings in. There isn't enough money in the country to bring us into balance if we keep allowing the government to spend like it has; not in the rich, not in the middle class, and not in the poor.

When are we going to realize that the only person responsible enough to secure our future is the one staring back at us in the mirror?

Government is not the answer to our problems, government is the problem.
he actually talked about never bailing out again due to certain regulations. you should watch the video.
please do not forget the bigger picture ... this Nation has a lot of sins, shame to overcome .. the Barak Obama man is here to amend some of them .. BLESS HIM
Get a clue, child. That Lincoln quote was Rockefeller Republicanism.

With respect, you perhaps need to pick up a book and learn what the definition of Socialism. WIth equal respect, pick up a copy of the Constitution and see exactly where the President is behaving in an unconstitutional manner, then list those points here, for all to see citing the Constitution precisely. Tiring: that is what all of the uninformed vitriol is becoming. The rest of the civilized world recognizes the "right" for what it truly is and perhaps it is time to think about the people government is meant to support. Shameful, unfounded verbal rubbish no longer cuts it. Bravo Mr. President!! Bravo....4 more years to allow you the mandate to change this very broken, shameful system of greed in government and vicious polemic.

How exactly is Obama a socialist?  How has he not adhered to the Constitution?  You are spouting buzz words with no substance behind them at all.  This country is not "run into the ground", it is better off than it was the day the President took office.  At that time it was pretty close to have been "run into the ground".  Did you really expect him to make everything right again in three years and with the albatross of a criminally obstructionist Congress hanging around his neck?

Obama is a socialist and does not adhere to the constitution.  All these pro Obama comments are so wrong.  You guys do not see how he has run this country into the ground.  He has been the worst president in history. Wise up and learn the facts.

This guy has such a nice, humble country way of speaking and acting toward people. I remember his comments after winning the Super Bowl in 2008. He and the team were on a grandstand on Broadway and Manning, a kid from Louisiana, said something to the effect that this was such a great city and it deserved the Super Bowl win. I never had any doubt that he was my favorite quarterback after that.
I think the team should be called the "Just Sayin'"s, reflecting the lowly team with perhaps the most asinine phrase in the history of the English language.
As long as you brought it up --- The Dodgers were originally the TROLLEY DODGERS -- because Brooklyn was covered with Trolley Cars.   Just sayin...

I hear what you are saying. My deceased husband was always hot and he also was considerably larger than I. We never agreed on the temperature and I believe it was because of his much greater layer of insulation. I am skinny by nature and cold all the time.

It is the same as a house--the more insulation the warmer the internal temperature. He was an R50 and I'm somewhere near an R12 therefore my "heating" bill is much larger in the winter and my "cooling" bill is much smaller in the summer. Simple BTUs.

FDR didn't have to deal with hard core obstructionalists. If the teaparty would have been around in the 30's we would probably be still fighting a cold war against a Nazi Europe.

Give Obama a Democratic and Independent Congress and you will see Capital gains and lobby reform, a new Glass Steagall and an end to corporate "person hood".

Once we get some basic reform the Dem and Republicans can get back to what should be their main priority, making sure that the 21st century is an American century.

President Obama has spoken. For the items I wanted to hear:

1. Glass Steagall - no mention.
2. Financial Regulation - Obama announced new regulation and enforcement authority to prevent future bailouts. Without the separation of investment and savings institutions (Glass-Steagall), the instruments are too complex to regulate and people's savings are held hostage. This was an empty promise.
3. Citizens United: Lip service - no mention of support for an amendment.
4. Capital gains tax: We can infer he supports this from some general statements.
5. Support for Social Security: again, we can infer this.
6. Fianacial transaction tax - no show.

The President showed a glimmer of chutzpah by making an end-run around Congress and using the military to build national energy infrastructure. And he made the right sounds about our industrial base.

Obama said this was a make or break moment for the middle class - and then appealed to Congress to allow it to happen. We needed FDR, and we got far less in terms of leadership tonight. Unfortunately, the alternative is far worse.

He said until they graduate or turn 18. So, if at 16 or 13, if you can graduate, you're all set. I knew a couple of kids in my hometown who took the GED at 15...they all passed. One has a PhD now.

Take as much time off for work or apprenticing as you want before going to college.

Wonderful idea.  Many disabled people would love to have an opportunity to work if their disability could be accomodated. There would also be a lot less people strung out on prescription drugs if they had something constructive to do with their time.

Stirring up emotion about bailouts is not going to help Obama in the election.

I preferred the Bush years when the government would send us tax-cut checks in the mail that someone else paid for....I have no idea who and I don't care.

It would be informative to know how many of the State AGs that are on board with this deal are Republicans vs. Democrats, or work for Republican vs. Democrat Governors. Both parties are complicit in this of course. It is President Obama's AG that is pushing/promoting this deal after all.

I would urge readers to Google: " Taibbi bank bailout " for a more in depth discussion of just how deep these banks' exposures run.

ex: Bank of America's exposure from its Countrywide holdings alone = $424 billion dollars!! From just one set of holdings.

$424,000,000,000 for a single bank's singular holdings vs. $25 billion for all the major banks' cumulative holdings.

Bank Bailout 2.0 for sure

Time to write your Congressmen, the President, and contact your own State AG Department to let them know how you feel about this. They don't spend their time reading comment sections.
Perhaps we can close the credit rating agencies altogether because they are nothing but a bunch of crooks selling snake oil.

Go to a local credit union or locally owned bank open an account by writing a check on your big five bank account for almost all or if you have auto bill pays set up leave a cushion to cover bills while you get changes made. It is not difficult. The easiest way is to cancel all the auto pay and write checks for a couple of months until everything is cleared.

Support your community by banking with a local institution. Keep the money in your community. You can shop for your new bank on line community credit unions are open to everyone in that city, county or defined area.
People in Canada should shut up about the real estate problem in the US. Go comment about personal responsibility about something going in your own country.

Why are the banks going to get immunity from prosecution for real lawbreaking? Why hasn't the Attorney General even made a thorough investigation after nearly four years in office?

Why should the public sign away their rights when they don't even know the scope of the lawbreaking? How is this in the public interest?

OK Rob in Philly. How about a check for 2 cents for all your virtuous people who are fiscally responsible, work hard and pay your bills? We are all very proud of you. Your a good boy. Now eat all your vegetables and mommy will give you desert.

I'm so sick of all the self-satisfied dorks who think they deserve some kind of prize for working hard and paying their bills. And they all fancy themselves as rugged individualists- you can bet your life that they are all just sheep-like followers with authoritarian personalities. They are the type that think the big banks on on their side because they pay their bills. Rob, the big bank that own your life doesn't even know you exist, and will hang you out to dry in a New York minute.

No billcarson from Santa Fe. I'm not looking for my $20,000. I don't need help with my mortgage because I sold my house in 2009 when I could see the writing on the walls. And when I sold the price had already dropped by about $100,000 from it's peak. But I don't sit around being resentful and whining about working hard and paying my bills like a self-satisfied jerk because other people may get a hand in hard times. Because I don't always look at the world solely in terms of what's in it for me.

Looks like billcarson should be looking forward to getting a life.

How about you go educate yourself before you put up another uninformed posting. A lot of us are losing patience with all the whiners whose only source of information is a Santorum rant run a million times on FOX. The real world is not as simple as you perceive it. And yes the banks should be forced to amend the loan terms of borrowers who have managed to stay current. Lower the APR or reduce the balance owed.
